subject: How to automate the testcases!
msgSnippet: Hi, I want to test a library containing more than 1000 classes and lots of methods. so, it is extreemely difficult for me to write a Testcase(just like having
messageBody:
Hi,
I want to test a library containing more than 1000 classes and
lots of methods. so, it is extreemely difficult for me to write
a Testcase(just like having VectorTest class for java.util.Vector in
the examples given in JUint)for each and every class of my library
and a correspoding test method(just like having testCapacity() method
corresponding to Capacity() method in Java.util.Vector )with assert
methods.
Is there a way to automate this process, i mean given a class can a
tool generate a corresponding Testclass having all testXXX(),setUp()
and tearDown() methods.
please let me know if this kind of feature is available with Junit or
any Extended tools of JUnit.
Thanks in Advance.

Regards,
Kishore.
